newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: China's Shanghai Petrochemical plans crude import.
newsitem.headline: China's Shanghai Petrochemical plans crude import.

text.p: China's Shanghai Petrochemical Co plans its maiden import of 1.0 million tonnes of crude in 1997, Chinese trade sources said on Thursday.
"In the past we didn't have to import any crude. We relied solely on Sinopec. But this year we have to start importing crude ourselves," a Shanghai Petrochemical Co official told Reuters.
In a policy shift, state-refiner Sinopec has cut crude supply to coastal refineries, in order to divert more supples to in-land refineries, Chinese sources said.
In 1996, Sinopec supplied 4.5 million tonnes of crude at around 1,000 yuan per tonne to the 240,000 barrels per day (bpd) Shanghai Petrochemical.
"The amount will be cut by 1.0 million tonnes in 1997," the official said.
This represents a 22 percent-cut in Sinopec's 4.5 million tonnes of crude supplied to Shanghai Petrochemical last year.
